Node.definition: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to eat > to enjoy|to eat > to use up
Node.definition: literally: to eat (goods); hence = pattern of actions by which someone makes a living off material goods until they are gone; ≈ often associated with joy
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans are in serious trouble, ◄ caused by a loss of status, health, wealth or a combination thereof
= state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans are ready and prepared to act when needed

Node.gloss: to be made fat > to prosper
Node.definition: = process by which humans are caused to prosper in life, described as becoming fat
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which humans become repulsive or loathsome to someone else ◄ as a result of antagonistic actions ► resulting in enmity between the parties involved
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a strong emotion of shame

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans behave as if they are poor and lack resources
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
= action by which two parties are engaged in a violent struggle involving physical force
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= causative action by which humans gather inanimate objects from different sources to keep for oneself or store it
literally: by hand; hence: = process by which a quantity increases in small increments

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= causative action by which deities cause a certain situation to last longer
= causative action by which events cause humans to experience an emotion of sadness
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

Node.gloss: to destroy|to ruin|to devastate|to break|to harm
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone brings destruction and suffering upon humans and inanimate objects
= state in which humans experience fear
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= state of not being subject to change

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
literally: to spread out an event; hence: = causative action by which humans perform a particular event in a very conspicuous way
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans become suddenly involved in a certain difficult situation
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= one who represents a person in authority and delivers his messages
= state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans are willing to undergo a process
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil

Node.gloss: to be pleasing|to be pleasant|to be sweet
Node.definition: = state in which an action brings about a positive and desireable feeling or reaction

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to suffer (harm)|to go badly|to be in trouble
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience difficulty or hardship as a consequence for wrong or harmful behavior
= pattern of actions by which humans commit specified or implied offenses, ► resulting in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune

= action by which humans or deities divide land and other possessions among (other) humans as their permanent possession, with special focus on the recipients and less on the object that is being divided
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= causative action by which humans store valuable objects in a particular location ► in order to keep them in a good condition or to keep them safe
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= unplowed soil; ► accessible to the poor to gather whatever food it produces; ≈ also associated with hardness and stubbornness
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to withhold the rod|to be reluctant to punish
Node.definition: literally: to withhold the rod; hence: = action by which humans are reluctant to administer punishment to someone else
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: to lack|to be in need (of something)
Node.definition: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have
